abstracts.cdata!:
The Mexico Tax Reform Adjustment Loan
            Project is expected to improve growth due to reduction of
            distortions in the tax system, enhance macroeconomic
            stability, improve equity in the personal income tax code,
            and provide more tax resources to finance social programs.
            In the area of corporate income taxes, the new law 1)
            eliminates the special cash-flow regime for calculating
            income for the agriculture and road transport sectors; 2)
            simplifies the inflation adjustment regime, just using the
            annual price index to calculate real change in monetary
            assets and liabilites; 3) eliminates the reduced tax rate
            for retained earnings, thus unifying the corporate and
            maximum personal tax rates at 35 percent, and reduces the
            rate gradually to 32 percent by 2005; 4) limits the
            corporate deductions for payment of fringe benefits to
            non-union workers; and 5) phases out the reduced tax rate
            for the publishing industry, bringing the rate up to the
            standard rate by 2006. In the area of personal income taxes,
            the new law 1) aggregates all the taxable income of an
            individual and taxes it at the corresponding progressive
            rate; 2) simplifies the structure of rates, reducing the
            number to five by 2005; 3) reduces the government subsidy
            for workers in the formal sector and provides incentives for
            firms to continue paying it; and 4) simplifies the tax
            regime for individuals with entrepreneurial activity.
